description:
Solid.js takes a unique approach to reactive state management that has broadly influenced other reactive front-end JavaScript frameworks. It provides a compact set of reactive primitives built on signals, rather than state, and leverages those to support higher-order functionality.

With a clean core design built for speed and a full set of enterprise features, Solid charted an impressive 90% developer satisfaction in the January 2025
title: Hands-on with Solid: Reactive programming with signals

description:
One of my favorite TV shows is The Bear. It’s a show about a troubled yet brilliant chef, his family, his friends, and the restaurant they all start together. It’s also about excellence and growing into greatness. 

The Bear includes what might be the best television episode I have ever seen. In Season 2, Episode 7, called “Forks,” a main character, Richie, spends a week at a top-tier restaurant to learn how things are done. 

Interestingly, what Richie does most of the week is polish and arrange the forks. At first, he resents it, but as the week goes on, he comes to understand the precision and discipline required to become a Michelin three-star restaurant. 

That le
title: The discipline of great code

description:
MariaDB, a company that as recently as last year was very much in transition due in part to the fact its new CEO, Rohit de Souza, is a specialist in preparing organizations for acquisition and resale, went in another direction Tuesday by making an acquisition of its own.

It brought SkySQL, the cloud-based database-as-a-service (DBaaS) platform which it spun off in late 2023 into an entity that was staffed by the former MariaDB employees who had built and supported the product, back into the fold.

In a
title: MariaDB buys back the company it sold two years ago
